meanings.definition: Not having a liking or affection for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She felt unfond towards the new student in class.
meanings.sent2: I am unfond of spicy food.
meanings.sent3: Even though the cat was cute, she remained unfond of it.
meanings.sent4: His unfond attitude towards exercise was evident in his reluctance to go for a run.
meanings.sent5: The unfond memories of that place still lingered in her mind.

meanings.definition: Not feeling fondness or affection towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The unfond look on her face showed her lack of affection.
meanings.sent2: He remained unfond of the idea of going to the party.
meanings.sent3: The unfond puppy refused to play fetch with its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her unfond feelings towards the movie were clear from her lack of enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The unfond goodbye left a bitter taste in her mouth.
